What was the purpose of using a cyclic alkyl amino carbene (CAAC) in the synthesis of the carbene-stabilized boryl anion?
data.answer: CAACs are slightly more nucleophilic but much more electrophilic than NHCs, making them suitable for favoring the deprotonation of a borohydride.

data.question: What was the result of attempting to deprotonate the CAAC(BH3) adduct 1?
data.answer: All attempts to deprotonate 1 failed, indicating that additional electron-withdrawing groups at boron were necessary.
